intro: Hedyotis spinescens, commonly known as the spiny bladdernut, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and thickets. Its small, white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Hedyotis spinescens is characterized by its spiny stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name.
